7.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 2"

notes: SUMMARY: History of England from 1215 to the end of the War of the Roses in 1485.

8.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 3"
8.author: written by Joseph H
8.appears_in: Park. 8 p. in True Comics, no. 43 (Spring 1945) ; reprinted (p. 120-127) in Children's Digest, no. 12 (Nov. 1951)
notes: SUMMARY: History of England from 1485 to the end of Elizabeth I's reign in 1603.

9.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 4"
9.author: written by Joseph H
9.appears_in: Park. 8 p. in True Comics, no. 45 (Fall 1945) ; reprinted (p. 120-127) in Children's Digest, no. 13 (Dec. 1951)

10.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 5"
10.author: written by Joseph H

11.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 6"

12.title: "Cavalcade of England : Chapter 7"

33.heading: Cavalieri, Joey.
33.title: Jewish Mice, Bubblegum Cards, Comics Art, & Raw Possibilities : an interview with Art Spiegelman & Francoise Mouly ; conducted by Joey Cavalieri.
33.author: [No author]
notes: Photocopy from: Comics Journal, no. 65 (August 1981)

SUMMARY: Interview in three sessions, the first (Cavalieri/Spiegelman) before the publication of Raw #1, the second (Cavalieri/ Spiegelman/Mouly) before the publication of Raw #2, and the third (Cavalieri/Spiegelman/Mouly/Thompson/Groth) before the publication of Raw #3. Topics covered include Spiegelman's fan and underground work, editing Arcade the Comics Revue, his work and consultantship with Topps Bubble Gum, work for Playboy, the history of Maus, and the beginnings of Raw. 1. Spiegelman, Art
Interviews. 2. Arcade, the Comics Revue. 3. Underground comic books, strips, etc.

History and criticism. 4. Raw. 5. Topps Chewing Gum, Inc. 6. Maus. I. Spiegelman, Art. II. Cavalieri, Joey. III. Mouly, Francoise. IV. Thompson, Kim. V. Groth, Gary. VI. Comics Journal, no. 65. Call no.: PN6727.S6J4 1981. Call no.: PN6700.C62no.65

115.heading: Cavazzano, Giorgio, 1947- --Exhibitions.
115.title: The Art of Giorgio Cavazzano
115.author: a cura di Luca Boschi, Mauro Bruni, Roberto Irace.

Exhibition catalog, with biography and articles about Cavazzano (1947-), including a chronology of his work, and samples of his art.

122.title: Cavco Longhorn inc. : file of advertising material.
122.author: [No author]
notes: 1 portfolio : ill. ; 25 x 38 cm.
Cavco Longhorn inc. is a distributor of comic books and related material, located in Dallas, Tex. and Kansas City, Ks.
Collected at Michigan State University in the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection's Popular Culture Vertical File (PCVF).

123.title: Cavalcade of England
notes: Historical feature in True Comics, (1944-1946) and later reprinted in Children's Digest (1951-1952)
